person.persName: אהבה So in BT. This person was obviously not well known, and his name was not stable so that the scribes of the mss were not sure how to write it, see vol. 4, Introduction 5.2.1.1.2.1.1, pp. 23-4. For this form see vol. 4, under Ahi (1) B/M, p. 56.
/אחוא So in yErub 6:7, 23d, and see previous note. For this form see vol. 4, under Ahi (1) B/M, p. 56.

/אחייא So in yBer 1:6, 3d, see above, n. 4. On the double י as a consonant see vol. 4, Introduction 2.3.4.3, p. 12. This is probably a variation of the biblical name אחיה, see below. On the replacement of the ה suffix with א see vol. 1, Introduction 2.4.2.7, p. 26.
